intro: Senecio paludosus f. hungaricus, commonly known as the Hungarian swamp Senecio, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and elongated leaves. This variant is typically found in moist, boggy habitats, thriving in wetland environments. The plant has a low-growing habit and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil. Its botanical features make it an important species for wetland biodiversity.
